yoruba: “Ọjọ́ tí mo ti ḿbọ̀ ng ò rírú ẹ̀ rí”: olúwa ẹ̀-ẹ́ mọ ìwọ̀n ara ẹ̀ ni.
gold: “In all the days I have walked this earth I have never seen the like”: that person knows his place.
gen:
Yoruba: "Ọjọ́ tí mo ti ḿbọ̀ ng ò rírú ẹ̀ rí": olúwa ẹ̀-ẹ́ mọ ìwọ̀n ara ẹ̀ ni.
English: "Since I've been worshipping, I've never seen anything like this": the owner knows his own limitations.
